intro: Neomonolepis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed lichen, is a member of the Lecanoraceae family. It is a foliose lichen, characterized by its leaf-like thallus structure. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and algae or cyanobacteria. It typically grows on bark, soil, or rocks in moist, shaded environments. Neomonolepis is often found in temperate regions and is used in ecological studies to monitor air quality.
